jparsec.math

Class Root

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.math.Root
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Root
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class to find roots using Newton-Raphson and midpoint methods.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • evaluateFunction

        public double evaluateFunction(java.lang.String f,
                      double x,
                      double y)
                        throws JPARSECException
        Evaluates a function of two variables, x and y.
        Parameters:
        f - Function expression.
        x - Value of x.
        y - Value of y.
        Returns:
        Function result.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getRootByNewtonRaphson

        public double[] getRootByNewtonRaphson(double E,
                              double x0,
                              double y0,
                              int limit_of_iterations)
                                throws JPARSECException
        Obtains a root by applying Newton Raphson. From Basic Scientific Subroutines, F. R. Ruckdeschel.
        Parameters:
        E - Tolerance (max. error desired). Must be slightly greater than 0.0.
        x0 - Real part of initial search point.
        y0 - Imaginary part of initial search point, only if the function has an imaginary compound.
        limit_of_iterations - Maximum number of iterations allowed.
        Returns:
        Array with real part, imaginary part (of the root), and number of iterations used, or null if the limit of iterations is too low.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getRootsRealFunction

        public double[] getRootsRealFunction(double E,
                            double xi,
                            double xf,
                            double step)
                              throws JPARSECException
        Obtain the roots of a real function, using a bisection like algorithm. No derivative is necessary.
        Parameters:
        E - Precision in the roots.
        xi - Initial search point.
        xf - End search point.
        step - Step between search points.
        Returns:
        All the roots found.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(double root,
                        double error)
        Transforms root result to string representation taking into account the reached precision. Usually the original root double precision value will be much better than the rounded value, so this method in not very useful.
        Parameters:
        root - Root value.
        error - Maximum error.
        Returns:
        Root value properly rounded.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        For unit testing only.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
